metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12213 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When FreeImage 3.18.0 reads a special TIFF file, the TIFFReadDirectory function in PluginTIFF.cpp always returns 1, leading to stack exhaustion. It was discovered that FreeImage incorrectly processed images under certain circumstances. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted TIFF file, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a stack exhaustion condition, resulting in a denial of service attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12213` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libfreeimage3 - 3.17.0+ds1-5+deb9u1build0.18.04.1
libfreeimageplus3 - 3.17.0+ds1-5+deb9u1build0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freeimage package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.17.0+ds1-5+deb9u1build0.18.04.1').
